org.apache.taverna.reference

Class AbstractExternalReference

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.taverna.reference.AbstractExternalReference
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, ExternalReferenceSPI
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlueReference, FileReference, GreenReference, HttpReference, InlineByteArrayReference, InlineStringReference, RedReference, VMObjectReference, YellowReference

    public abstract class AbstractExternalReference
extends Object
implements ExternalReferenceSPI
    A trivial implementation of ExternalReference. This abstract class should be used as the superclass of any ExternalReference implementations as it provides base metadata for the hibernate-based persistence system used by the main reference manager implementation. While the interface contract cannot require this your extensions will likely not work properly unless you use this class.
    Author:
    Tom Oinn

      • setPrimaryKey

        public final void setPrimaryKey(int newKey)
        Used by Hibernate internally to establish a foreign key relationship between this abstract superclass and tables corresponding to implementations of the ExternalReference interface. Has no impact on any application level code, this method is only ever used by the internals of the hibernate framework.

Has no impact on any application level code, this method is only ever used by the internals of the hibernate framework.

        public String getCharset()
        Default to returning null for charset

      • getResolutionCost

        public float getResolutionCost()
        Default to a value of 0.0f for the resolution cost, but implementations should at least attempt to set this to a more sensible level!
        Specified by:
        getResolutionCost in interface ExternalReferenceSPI
        Returns:
        a float representing some notion of resolution cost, lower values represent cheaper de-reference paths.
